creator: susan.maddison@arena-online.com
text:
I have this problem with DailyRollingFileAppender & RollingFileAppender, 
whether older logs are appended with a number (.1) or yesterday's date (.2003-
07-14), log4j intermittently appends to an old log.

Example 1: On 14 Jul should be writing to BuildReport.log, not yesterday's log.
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   4568493 Jul 14 23:54 BuildReport.log.2003-07-13

Example 2: idtvJSP/IM.log are the current logs and others should be old logs 
(and at max space), as you can see they're all being written to!
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   5071714 Jul 15 17:04 idtvIM.log.1
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   4934517 Jul 15 17:07 idtvJSP.log.1
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   5291776 Jul 15 17:07 idtvIM.log
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   6059010 Jul 15 17:07 idtvIM.log.3
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   5694308 Jul 15 17:07 idtvIM.log.2
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   5661469 Jul 15 17:07 idtvJSP.log.2
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   5284844 Jul 15 17:07 idtvJSP.log.3
-rw-rw-rw-   1 bvuser   bv1to1   5185904 Jul 15 17:07 idtvJSP.log

My log4j.properties:
# iDTV Interaction Manager Extended Logging properties. 
log4j.appender.IMExtendedAppender=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.IMExtendedAppender.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.IMExtendedAppender.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p %d [%t] %C{1}.%
M - %m%n
log4j.appender.IMExtendedAppender.File=/usr/local/bvuser/logs/idtvIM.log
#log4j.appender.IMExtendedAppender.ImmediateFlush=false
log4j.appender.IMExtendedAppender.MaxFileSize=10MB
log4j.appender.IMExtendedAppender.MaxBackupIndex=5

# iDTV Interaction Manager Normal Logging properties.
log4j.appender.IMAppender=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.IMAppender.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.IMAppender.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p %d [%t] %C - %m%n
log4j.appender.IMAppender.File=/usr/local/bvuser/logs/idtvIM.log
#log4j.appender.IMAppender.ImmediateFlush=false
log4j.appender.IMAppender.MaxFileSize=10MB
log4j.appender.IMAppender.MaxBackupIndex=5

# iDTV JSP Extended Logging properties. 
log4j.appender.JSPExtendedAppender=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.JSPExtendedAppender.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.JSPExtendedAppender.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p %d [%t] %C{1}.%
M - %m%n
log4j.appender.JSPExtendedAppender.File=/usr/local/bvuser/logs/idtvJSP.log
#log4j.appender.JSPExtendedAppender.ImmediateFlush=false
log4j.appender.JSPExtendedAppender.MaxFileSize=10MB
log4j.appender.JSPExtendedAppender.MaxBackupIndex=5

# iDTV JSP Normal Logging properties.
log4j.appender.JSPAppender=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.JSPAppender.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.JSPAppender.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p %d [%t] %C - %m%n
log4j.appender.JSPAppender.File=/usr/local/bvuser/logs/idtvJSP.log
#log4j.appender.JSPAppender.ImmediateFlush=false
log4j.appender.JSPAppender.MaxFileSize=10MB
log4j.appender.JSPAppender.MaxBackupIndex=5

# iDTV Studio(Piranha) Logging properties.
log4j.appender.StudioAppender=org.apache.log4j.FileAppender
log4j.appender.StudioAppender.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.StudioAppender.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p %d [%t] %C - %m%n
log4j.appender.StudioAppender.DatePattern='.'yyyy-MM-dd
log4j.appender.StudioAppender.File=/usr/local/bvuser/logs/studio.log
#log4j.appender.StudioAppender.ImmediateFlush=false

Are the log files being accessed by other applications? What is the context for 
this bug? Operating system? JVM? What kind of application is this?

text: This is a java app running in Broadvision servlet/JVM. Does this help?
creator: susan.maddison@arena-online.com

text:
Are there other apps running in the same server, or does the server itself use 
log4j?  Or is log4j.jar placed in a common classloader repository on the 
server?  Assuming at least one of these is true, I suggest you read 
http://www.qos.ch/logging/sc.jsp.  (That is, if you're still experiencing this 
issue and still care about it ;)  It's been 17 months or so)...
